author: Staff Reporter
text:
The State Human Rights Commission has asked the Corporation of Chennai and Chennai Metropolitan Water Supply and Sewage Board to submit a detailed report on the state of P.S. Sivaswamy Salai road in Mylapore.

Taking suo motu cognisance of a report ‘Financial Cruch keeps Sivaswamy Salai crippled’ published in The Hindu on Monday, the Commission directed the Corporation and Chennai Metrowater to take notice of the issue. The commission said that the matter had been listed for further consideration after four weeks.

A portion of the road had caved-in last November and while the stretch had been temporarily set right, a thorough repair work and re-laying of roads had to be done.

The stretch was filled with mud, debris and material such as steel rods on one side and most heavy vehicles had to take diversions.

The dust on the stretch due to the debris had also put many pedestrians to hardship.

The matter has been listed for further consideration after four weeks
title: SHRC directs Metrowater, Corpn. to submit report
